tweets.text: The future of AI is not about replacing humans, but augmenting them. We're building tools that make everyone more capable.
Every company will become an AI company, just like every company became an internet company. The question is how fast.
The best AI products are invisible. They just work, and you don't think about them.
Building in public is the new marketing. Show your work, share your process, and people will follow.
The internet is still in its early days. We're just scratching the surface of what's possible.
Complexity is the enemy of progress. Simple solutions often work better than complex ones.
The best startups solve real problems for real people. Everything else is just noise.
Distribution is the hardest part of building a startup. Great products don't sell themselves.
Software is eating the world, and AI is eating software. The transformation is just beginning.
The future of work is remote, async, and distributed. Companies that adapt will win.

Indie maker. Building profitable side projects.
Founder of TinySeed. Investing in bootstrapped startups.
Founder of Freckle Time Tracking. Building profitable SaaS.
Indie maker. Building profitable software businesses.
Founder of ConvertKit. Building email tools for creators.
Founder of Sifter. Building simple issue tracking.
Co-founder of 37signals. Building Basecamp and HEY.
Creator of Ruby on Rails. CTO of 37signals.

tweets.text: The best SaaS products solve one problem really well. Don't try to be everything to everyone.
Pricing is hard, but it's the most important decision you'll make. Charge more than you think.
Customer support is your competitive advantage. Respond fast, be helpful, and people will remember.
Building in public is the best marketing strategy for indie makers. Share your journey.
The best time to start a SaaS business was 10 years ago. The second best time is now.
Revenue solves all problems. Focus on getting to $1k MRR, then $10k, then $100k.
Don't build features, solve problems. Your customers will tell you what to build next.
The best SaaS products are boring. They solve real problems for real businesses.
Indie makers don't need VC funding. They need customers who pay for their product.
Bootstrapped startups have more freedom. You answer to customers, not investors.

tweets.text: Great products are built by great teams. Invest in your people, and they'll build amazing things.
Product strategy is about saying no to good ideas so you can say yes to great ones.
The best products solve real problems for real people. Everything else is just features.
Product-market fit is not a destination, it's a journey. Keep iterating until you find it.
The best product managers are customer-obsessed. They understand their users better than anyone.
Building great products requires patience. Don't rush to launch, take time to get it right.
Product management is about making hard decisions with incomplete information. Get comfortable with uncertainty.
The best products are built by empowered teams. Give your team the autonomy to make decisions.
Product discovery is just as important as product delivery. Spend time understanding your users.
The best products are simple. Complexity is the enemy of great user experiences.

tweets.text: Great design is invisible. When it's done well, you don't notice it, you just use it.
Visual design is about communication. Every element should have a purpose.
The best designs are simple. Complexity is the enemy of great user experiences.
Design systems are about consistency. They help teams build better products faster.
Good design is about solving problems, not making things look pretty.
The best designers are user-obsessed. They understand their users better than anyone.
Design is about making things work better. Focus on function, not form.
The best designs are opinionated. They make decisions for users, not with them.
Great design is about empathy. Understand your users, and you'll build better products.
The best products are beautifully designed. They're a joy to use, not just functional.

tweets.text: The best startups solve real problems for real people. Everything else is just noise.
Starting a company is hard. But if you're solving a real problem, it's worth it.
The best founders are customer-obsessed. They understand their users better than anyone.
Building a startup is about making hard decisions with incomplete information. Get comfortable with uncertainty.
The best startups are built by small teams. Focus on hiring great people, not many people.
Starting a company is about solving problems, not raising money. Focus on customers, not investors.
The best founders are product-obsessed. They care about every detail of their product.
Building in public is the best marketing strategy for startups. Share your journey.
The best startups are built by founders who are passionate about their problem. Find your why.
Starting a company is about taking risks. But calculated risks, not blind ones.

tweets.text: Growth is about finding what works and doubling down on it. Test everything, keep what works.
The best growth strategies are built on understanding your users. Know your customers better than anyone.
Growth is about consistency. Show up every day, and you'll see results over time.
The best growth channels are the ones your competitors aren't using. Find your unique advantage.
Growth is about experimentation. Try new things, measure results, and iterate.
The best growth strategies are built on great products. Focus on product first, growth second.
Growth is about building relationships. Connect with your users, and they'll help you grow.
The best growth strategies are built on word-of-mouth. Build something people want to share.
Growth is about patience. Don't expect overnight success, focus on long-term growth.
The best growth strategies are built on authenticity. Be yourself, and people will connect with you.

accounts.bio: Founder of Femtech Insider. Building the future of women's health.
Founder of Elvie. Building products for women's health.
Founder of Kindbody. Building accessible fertility care.

tweets.text: Femtech is about solving real problems for real women. We're building products that matter.
Women's health has been underserved for too long. We're changing that, one product at a time.
Accessible fertility care is a human right. We're making it available to everyone.
Telehealth is the future of healthcare. We're building the infrastructure to make it happen.
Personalized health is the future. We're using data to improve outcomes for everyone.
The future of work includes better healthcare for women. We're investing in that future.
Great products are built by diverse teams. We need more women in tech, especially in health.
Building products for women's health is important work. We're making a difference.
The creator economy includes health creators. We're building tools to support them.
Small businesses can make a big impact in healthcare. We're proving that every day.
